hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Exchange Liquidity Arbitrage During Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: During market stress events, liquidity fragmentation creates persistent 0.8-1.2% price discrepancies between Coinbase and Binance for BTC/USD pairs, with mean reversion occurring within 45 minutes as arbitrage capital activates.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers reduce inventory during stress, creating fragmented liquidity. Specialized arbitrage desks have capacity constraints, allowing retail-quant strategies to capture residual spreads before normalization.
entry_conditions: Price spread between Coinbase Pro and Binance BTC/USD > 0.8%
VIX index > 25 or crypto fear & greed index < 30

exit_conditions.take_profit: Spread closes to < 0.15% or 0.6% profit captured
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spread widens to > 1.5% or position held > 60 minutes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If spreads persist beyond 60 minutes without mean reversion, indicating structural market fragmentation rather than temporary dislocation.
